item.title: Graffiti, 24th September
item.description:
There is graffiti in Hatherley Crescent on a disused shed, behind Jennings & Barrett estate agents & on an electrical box & on Smudge hairdressers opposite which is empty & on the glass shop alongside on the shutter There is also graffiti in station road by the the 11 plus tuition building & also on the slope up to Sidcup station

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Road, Longlands, London

item.title: Rubbish dumped on Tuesday night, 24th September
item.description:
Rubbish bags dumped last night (Tuesday), when collection will only be on Friday morning. Not the first time that this has occurred. Bags are intentionally dumped at the flank of No. 27 Ennismore Gardens, away from any front door and relatively out of site, although not to foxes etc. This tactic is likely due to a former complaint that linked dumping to a specific door number.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, Ennismore Gardens, Knightsbridge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: St George flags ARE a source of tension, 24th September
item.description:
Your site currently claims that you are not aware of any tensions caused by the St George flags which are rife in the area - I, along with many others, are deeply offended by these flags appearing, specifically in this case, on poles all around the b&q roundabout at Sidcup/Footscray. If rainbow Pride flags were popping up all over or replacing the St George flags, would you also find these not a problem? If these flags aren't removed along with all of the de-facing, ridiculous red crosses painted on zebra crossings I will be tempted to remove and replace them myself. There is no reason for anyone to be allowed to be doing this, it is deeply offensive to so many residents.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sidcup By-pass, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Boy exposing himself in childrenâ€™s playground, 24th September
item.description:

item.title: Dog Mess on Mina Road, 24th September
item.description:
Mina Road is being deliberately used for dogs to leave their mess. There is regularly dog mess left along the length of the road but particularly in front of residences 2-16 Mina Road. This has been happening for at least 5 years.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mina Road, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
